title: [Large-Scale] Learning Analytics-Based Integrated Design Workshop for Mathematics Instruction Observation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic lesson design and learning analytics concepts, experience in teaching mathematics, instructional experience with core concepts (equations, functions, geometry)
context.additional_context: Strengthening instructional design competencies for in-service math teachers/educators by integrating learning analytics and classroom observation. Focuses on error pattern analysis during math concept acquisition and feedback strategy development

learning_goals: Educational insights into problem-solving strategies and conceptual understanding can be derived by linking learning analytics data with math class observation records.
Participatory design can be used to develop observation tools optimized for math classes, such as equation-solving process tracking and graph interpretation pattern analysis.
Focus group interview techniques can be employed to share a math observation framework (e.g., variable control, proof process evaluation) with peer teachers.

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) Device Support Guide

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
